discovery_rule.name: Instances
discovery_rule.params:
<parms type="oracle" prefix="oracle."> <server> <discovery time="120" item="discovery.DBforBIX.config[instanceid,{$DSN}]" names="INST_ID">SELECT inst_id FROM gv$instance</discovery> <query time="60" item="stats[%1,%2]"> SELECT inst_id, REPLACE(name,' ','_'), value FROM gv$sysstat WHERE name IN ('user I/O wait time','physical read total bytes','physical write total bytes','lob reads','lob writes','db block changes','db block gets','consistent gets','physical reads','physical reads direct','physical writes direct','redo writes','physical read requests optimized','physical write requests optimized') </query> <query time="60" item="stats[%1,%2]"> select inst_id,'dbhitratio',trunc((sum(decode(name,'consistent gets', value,0)) + sum(decode(name,'db block gets', value,0)) - sum(decode(name,'physical reads', value,0))) / (sum(decode(name,'consistent gets', value,0)) + sum(decode(name,'db block gets', value,0)) ) * 100,2) "hit_ratio" FROM gv$sysstat group by inst_id </query>
<query time="900" item="parameter[%1,%2]">SELECT inst_id,name,value FROM gv$parameter WHERE name IN ('processes','sessions','sga_max_size','memory_target','memory_max_target','shared_pool_reserved_size','db_block_size','log_buffer','db_files','parallel_server_instances','cluster_database_instances','db_flashback_retention_target','distributed_lock_timeout','create_bitmap_area_size','bitmap_merge_area_size','hash_area_size','sort_area_size','pga_aggregate_target','pga_aggregate_limit')</query>
<query time="60" item="sgastat[%1,%2]"> SELECT inst_id,decode(nvl(pool,'none'), 'shared pool','pool_sql_area', 'none','sga_bufcache', 'java pool','java_pool', 'large pool','large_pool' ), SUM(bytes) bytes FROM GV$SGASTAT where (nvl(pool,'none'),name) in ( ('shared pool','sql area'), ('shared pool','SQLA'), ('none','db_block_buffers'), ('none','buffer_cache') ) or pool in ('java pool','large pool') group by inst_id, nvl(pool,'none') </query> <query time="60" item="sgastat[%1,%2]"> SELECT inst_id, name, sum(bytes) bytes FROM GV$SGASTAT where pool is null and name in ('fixed_sga','log_buffer') group by inst_id, name </query> <query time="60" item="sgastat[%1,%2]"> SELECT inst_id, 'pool_misc',sum(bytes) bytes FROM GV$SGASTAT where pool in ('shared pool') and name not in ('library cache','dictionary cache','free memory','sql area','SQLA') group by inst_id </query> <query time="60" item="sgastat[%1,%2]"> SELECT inst_id, REPLACE(name,' ','_'),sum(bytes) bytes FROM GV$SGASTAT where pool in ('shared pool') and name in ('dictionary cache','free memory','library cache','sql area','SQLA') group by inst_id, name </query>
<query time="60" item="uptime[%1]" nodata="0">SELECT inst_id, ROUND((sysdate-startup_time)*86400) retvalue FROM gv$instance</query> <query time="60" item="procnum[%1]">SELECT inst_id,COUNT(*) procnum from gv$process group by inst_id</query> <query time="120" item="miss_latch[%1]">SELECT inst_id,SUM(misses) FROM GV$LATCH group by inst_id</query> <query time="120" item="sessions[%1]" nodata="0">SELECT inst_id, COUNT(*) FROM gv$session group by inst_id</query> <query time="120" item="session_system[%1]" nodata="0">SELECT inst_id, COUNT(*) FROM gv$session WHERE type='BACKGROUND' group by inst_id</query> <query time="120" item="session_active[%1]" nodata="0">SELECT inst_id, COUNT(*) FROM gv$session WHERE type!='BACKGROUND' AND status='ACTIVE' group by inst_id</query> <query time="120" item="users_connected[%1]" nodata="0"> SELECT inst_id, count(username) FROM gv$session WHERE username is not null group by inst_id </query> <query time="600" item="dbfilesize">SELECT SUM(NVL(bytes,0)) val FROM dba_data_files</query> <query time="600" item="dbsize"> SELECT SUM(NVL(a.bytes, 0) - NVL(f.bytes, 0)) val FROM sys.dba_tablespaces d, (SELECT tablespace_name, SUM(bytes) bytes FROM dba_data_files GROUP BY tablespace_name) a, (SELECT tablespace_name, SUM(bytes) bytes FROM dba_free_space GROUP BY tablespace_name) f WHERE d.tablespace_name = a.tablespace_name(+) AND d.tablespace_name = f.tablespace_name(+) AND NOT ( d.extent_management LIKE 'LOCAL' AND d.contents LIKE 'TEMPORARY' ) </query> <query time="600" item="session_io_log" nodata="none"> select LISTAGG(SUBSTR(sessions_tab,1,395),chr(10)) WITHIN GROUP(ORDER BY PCT desc) sessions from ( select INST_ID||': '||'PCT[R/W/T,MB/s]='||PCT||'['||SESSION_IO_R_MBps||'/'||SESSION_IO_W_MBps||'/'||TOTAL_IO_MBps||'];SQL_(ID/FULL_PLAN_HV)='||SQL_ID||'/'||sql_plan_hash_value||';SID='||sid||'#'||SERIAL#||';(SCH/USER)NAME='||SCHEMANAME||'/'||USERNAME||';STATUS='||STATUS||';TYPE='||TYPE||';OSUSER='||OSUSER||';PROGRAM='||REGEXP_REPLACE(PROGRAM,'@.*$','')||'@'||MACHINE||';PROCESS='||PROCESS||';'||DESCRIPTION sessions_tab, PCT from ( select b.inst_id,b.sid,b.SERIAL#,b.SCHEMANAME,b.OSUSER,b.USERNAME,b.STATUS,b.SQL_ID,b.PROCESS,b.PROGRAM,b.MACHINE,b.TYPE, round(100*(sio.SESSION_IO_R+sio.SESSION_IO_W)/fio.TOTAL_IO,2) PCT,round(sio.SESSION_IO_R,2) SESSION_IO_R_MBps, round(sio.SESSION_IO_W,2) SESSION_IO_W_MBps,round(fio.TOTAL_IO, 2) TOTAL_IO_MBps,p.DESCRIPTION, sio.sql_plan_hash_value from gv$session b, gv$bgprocess p, ( select inst_id, sum(((DELTA_READ_IO_BYTES/1024/1024)+(DELTA_WRITE_IO_BYTES/1024/1024))/(DELTA_TIME/1000000))/600 total_io from GV$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY where sample_time > sysdate-10/24/60 group by inst_id ) fio,( select inst_id, session_id,sum((DELTA_READ_IO_BYTES/1024/1024)/(DELTA_TIME/1000000))/600 session_io_r, sum((DELTA_WRITE_IO_BYTES/1024/1024)/(DELTA_TIME/1000000))/600 session_io_w, sql_plan_hash_value from GV$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY where sample_time > sysdate-10/24/60 group by inst_id, session_id, sql_plan_hash_value ) sio where p.paddr(+) = b.paddr and p.inst_id(+)=b.inst_id and sio.session_id = b.sid and sio.inst_id=b.inst_id and fio.inst_id=b.inst_id order by PCT desc nulls last ) where rownum < 11) </query>
<query time="600" item="archivelog_size[%1]" nodata="0"> select A.inst_id, round(A.LOGS*B.AVG/10) from ( SELECT inst_id, COUNT (*) LOGS FROM GV$LOG_HISTORY WHERE FIRST_TIME >= (sysdate -10/60/24) group by inst_id ) A, ( SELECT inst_id, Avg(BYTES) AVG, Count(1), Max(BYTES) Max_Bytes, Min(BYTES) Min_Bytes FROM gv$log group by inst_id ) B where A.inst_id=B.inst_id </query>
<query time="120" item="db_locks" nodata="none"> select SUBSTR( sessions,1,2040)session_cut from ( select LISTAGG(SUBSTR(sessions_tab,1,395), chr(10)) WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY sessions_tab desc) sessions from ( select blocking_sessions.inst_id||':'||chr(9)|| 'OBJ: '||o.owner || '.' ||o.object_name ||chr(10)||chr(9)||chr(9)|| 'BG: SID=' || blocking_sessions.sid ||'/'||blocking_sessions.serial#||'|'||blocking_sessions.status || '|USER/SCHEMA=' ||blocking_sessions.username||'/'||blocking_sessions.schemaname || '|OSUSER=' ||blocking_sessions.osuser || '|' ||REGEXP_REPLACE(blocking_sessions.program,'@.*$','') || '@' ||blocking_sessions.machine || '|' ||blocking_sessions.sql_id ||chr(10)||chr(9)||chr(9)|| 'BD: SID=' || blocked_sessions.sid ||'/' || blocked_sessions.serial#||'|'||blocked_sessions.status || '|USER/SCHEMA=' ||blocked_sessions.username||'/'||blocked_sessions.schemaname || '|OSUSER=' ||blocked_sessions.osuser || '|' ||REGEXP_REPLACE(blocked_sessions.program,'@.*','')||'@'||blocked_sessions.machine || '|' ||blocked_sessions.sql_id sessions_tab from ( select inst_id,sid,serial#,status,username,schemaname,osuser,machine,program,blocking_session,final_blocking_session, row_wait_obj# blocked_objects,sql_id from gv$session where event like 'enq:%' and final_blocking_session_status = 'VALID' ) blocked_sessions, gv$session blocking_sessions, dba_objects o where blocking_sessions.inst_id=blocked_sessions.inst_id and blocking_sessions.sid = blocked_sessions.final_blocking_session and o.object_id = blocked_sessions.blocked_objects ) where rownum < 11 ) </query>
<query time="120" item="db_pga[%1]" nodata="0"> select inst_id, value from GV$PGASTAT where name in 'total PGA inuse' </query>
<multiquery time="120" items="dbwaits_latch[%1]|dbwaits_logwrite[%1]|dbwaits_file_io[%1]|waits_directpath_read[%1]|dbwaits_multiblock_read[%1]|dbwaits_other[%1]|dbwaits_singleblock_read[%1]|dbwaits_sqlnet[%1]" nodata="0" type="column"> SELECT inst_id, to_char(sum(decode(event,'control file sequential read', total_waits,'control file single write', total_waits, 'control file parallel write',total_waits,0))) ControlFileIO, to_char(sum(decode(event,'log file single write',total_waits, 'log file parallel write',total_waits,0))) LogWrite, to_char(sum(decode(event,'file identify',total_waits, 'file open',total_waits,0))) FileIO, to_char(sum(decode(event,'direct path read',total_waits,0))) DirectPathRead, to_char(sum(decode(event,'db file scattered read',total_waits,0))) MultiBlockRead, to_char(sum(decode(event,'control file sequential read',0,'control file single write',0,'control file parallel write',0,'db file sequential read',0,'db file scattered read',0,'direct path read',0,'file identify',0,'file open',0,'SQL*Net message to client',0,'SQL*Net message to dblink',0, 'SQL*Net more data to client',0,'SQL*Net more data to dblink',0, 'SQL*Net break/reset to client',0,'SQL*Net break/reset to dblink',0, 'log file single write',0,'log file parallel write',0,total_waits))) Other, to_char(sum(decode(event,'db file sequential read',total_waits,0))) SingleBlockRead, to_char(sum(decode(event,'SQL*Net message to client',total_waits,'SQL*Net message to dblink',total_waits,'SQL*Net more data to client',total_waits,'SQL*Net more data to dblink',total_waits,'SQL*Net break/reset to client',total_waits,'SQL*Net break/reset to dblink',total_waits,0))) SQLNET FROM GV$system_event WHERE event not in ('SQL*Net message from client','SQL*Net more data from client','pmon timer', 'rdbms ipc message','rdbms ipc reply', 'smon timer') group by inst_id </multiquery>
<query time="60" item="zabbix[%1,%2]" nodata="none"> select inst_id,'activesessions', count(*) activeSessions from gv$session where SCHEMANAME=upper('{$DB_USER}') and SQL_EXEC_START is not null group by inst_id </query>
<query time="60" item="zabbix[%1,%2]" nodata="none"> select inst_id, 'sessions', count(*) Sessions from gv$session where SCHEMANAME=upper('{$DB_USER}') group by inst_id </query>
<query time="600" item="zabbix_session_io_log" nodata="none"> select LISTAGG(SUBSTR(sessions_tab,1,395),chr(10)) WITHIN GROUP(ORDER BY PCT desc) sessions from ( select INST_ID||': '||'PCT[R/W/T,MB/s]='||PCT||'['||SESSION_IO_R_MBps||'/'||SESSION_IO_W_MBps||'/'||TOTAL_IO_MBps||'];SQL_(ID/FULL_PLAN_HV)='||SQL_ID||'/'||sql_plan_hash_value||';SID='||sid||'#'||SERIAL#||';(SCH/USER)NAME='||SCHEMANAME||'/'||USERNAME||';STATUS='||STATUS||';TYPE='||TYPE||';OSUSER='||OSUSER||';PROGRAM='||REGEXP_REPLACE(PROGRAM,'@.*$','')||'@'||MACHINE||';PROCESS='||PROCESS||';'||DESCRIPTION sessions_tab, PCT from ( select b.inst_id,b.sid,b.SERIAL#,b.SCHEMANAME,b.OSUSER,b.USERNAME,b.STATUS,b.SQL_ID,b.PROCESS,b.PROGRAM,b.MACHINE,b.TYPE, round(100*(sio.SESSION_IO_R+sio.SESSION_IO_W)/fio.TOTAL_IO,2) PCT,round(sio.SESSION_IO_R,2) SESSION_IO_R_MBps, round(sio.SESSION_IO_W,2) SESSION_IO_W_MBps,round(fio.TOTAL_IO, 2) TOTAL_IO_MBps,p.DESCRIPTION, sio.sql_plan_hash_value from gv$session b, gv$bgprocess p, ( select inst_id, sum(((DELTA_READ_IO_BYTES/1024/1024)+(DELTA_WRITE_IO_BYTES/1024/1024))/(DELTA_TIME/1000000))/600 total_io from GV$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY where sample_time > sysdate-10/24/60 group by inst_id ) fio,( select inst_id, session_id,sum((DELTA_READ_IO_BYTES/1024/1024)/(DELTA_TIME/1000000))/600 session_io_r, sum((DELTA_WRITE_IO_BYTES/1024/1024)/(DELTA_TIME/1000000))/600 session_io_w, sql_plan_hash_value from GV$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY where sample_time > sysdate-10/24/60 group by inst_id, session_id, sql_plan_hash_value ) sio where p.paddr(+) = b.paddr and p.inst_id(+)=b.inst_id and sio.session_id = b.sid and sio.inst_id=b.inst_id and fio.inst_id=b.inst_id and b.SCHEMANAME = upper('{$DB_USER}') order by PCT desc nulls last ) where rownum < 11) </query>
<multiquery time="60" items="zabbixsessionioread[%1]|zabbixsessioniowrite[%1]" nodata="none" type="column"> select ash.inst_id, sum((DELTA_READ_IO_BYTES/(DELTA_TIME/1000000))/60), sum((DELTA_WRITE_IO_BYTES/(DELTA_TIME/1000000))/60) from GV$ACTIVE_SESSION_HISTORY ash JOIN dba_users u on username=upper('{$DB_USER}') where sample_time > sysdate - 1/24/60 and u.user_id=ash.USER_ID group by ash.inst_id </multiquery>
</server> </parms>

discovery_rule.name: Librarycache
discovery_rule.params: <parms type="oracle" prefix="oracle."> <server> <discovery time="120" item="discovery.DBforBIX.config[librarycache,{$DSN}]" names="NAMESPACE">SELECT REPLACE(namespace,' ','_') FROM v$librarycache</discovery> <query time="120" item="librarycache.hitratio[%1]">SELECT REPLACE(namespace,' ','_'), trunc(gethitratio*100,2) get_pct FROM v$librarycache</query> <query time="120" item="librarycache.pinhitratio[%1]">SELECT REPLACE(namespace,' ','_'), trunc(pins/(pins+reloads)*100,2) pin_hit_ratio FROM v$librarycache WHERE (pins+reloads)!=0</query> </server> </parms>

discovery_rule.name: Tablespaces
discovery_rule.params: <parms type="oracle" prefix="oracle."> <server> <discovery time="600" item="discovery.DBforBIX.config[tablespace,{$DSN}]" names="TABLESPACE">SELECT DISTINCT name FROM v$tablespace WHERE name NOT IN ('TEMP')</discovery> <multiquery time="300" items="tablespace.bytes[%1]|tablespace.maxbytes[%1]" type="column">SELECT d.tablespace_name, SUM(d.bytes)-(SELECT SUM(bytes) FROM dba_free_space WHERE tablespace_name=d.tablespace_name) bytes, SUM(DECODE(d.autoextensible, 'YES', d.maxbytes, d.bytes)) maxbytes FROM dba_data_files d GROUP BY d.tablespace_name</multiquery> </server> </parms>

trigger_prototype.name: Tablespace {#TABLESPACE} size is {ITEM.LASTVALUE2} (>{$TBS_HIGH_LIMIT}*{ITEM.LASTVALUE1}) on {HOST.NAME}

discovery_rule.name: Discovery ASM diskgroup
discovery_rule.params:
<parms type="oracle" prefix="oracle."> <server> <discovery time="300" item="discovery.DBforBIX.config[ASM,{$DSN}]" names="INST_ID|NAME"> select INST_ID, NAME from gv$asm_diskgroup </discovery> <multiquery time="120" items="asm[FREE_MB,%1,%2]|asm[TOTAL_MB,%1,%2]" type="column"> select INST_ID, NAME, FREE_MB,TOTAL_MB from gv$asm_diskgroup </multiquery>
<multiquery time="60" items="asm[reads,%1,%2]|asm[writes,%1,%2]|asm[read_util,%1,%2]|asm[write_util,%1,%2]|asm[read_bytes,%1,%2]|asm[write_bytes,%1,%2]" type="column"> select dg.inst_id, dg.name, sum(reads), sum(writes), avg(read_time), avg(write_time), sum(bytes_read), sum(bytes_written) from gv$asm_disk_stat ds, gv$asm_diskgroup dg where ds.group_number=dg.group_number and ds.inst_id=dg.inst_id group by dg.inst_id, dg.name </multiquery>
</server> </parms>

ASM DG {#NAME} IO read on inst={#INST_ID}
ASM DG {#NAME} utilization read on inst={#INST_ID}
ASM DG {#NAME} IOps writes on inst={#INST_ID}
ASM DG {#NAME} IO write on inst={#INST_ID}
ASM DG {#NAME} utilization write on inst={#INST_ID}

template.name: Template Net Brocade FC SNMPv2
template.description:
Template Net Brocade FC version: 0.11 MIBs used: SW-MIB ENTITY-MIB
Known Issues: description : no IF-MIB::ifAlias is available version : v6.3.1c and v7.0.0c device : SW5480

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: SW-MIB System's CPU usage.

item.name: Firmware version
item.description: MIB: SW-MIB

item.name: Hardware serial number
item.description: MIB: SW-MIB

item.name: Overall system health status
item.description: MIB: SW-MIB The current operational status of the switch.The states are as follow: online(1) means the switch is accessible by an external Fibre Channel port offline(2) means the switch is not accessible testing(3) means the switch is in a built-in test mode and is not accessible by an external Fibre Channel port faulty(4) means the switch is not operational.

item.name: Memory utilization

item.name: System: Temperature status
item.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB This value specifies the overall condition of the system's thermal environment. This value will be one of the following: other(1) Temperature could not be determined. ok(2) The temperature sensor is within normal operating range. degraded(3) The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system.

item.name: Hardware model name
item.description: MIB: CPQSINFO-MIB The machine product name.The name of the machine used in this system.

item.name: Hardware serial number
item.description: MIB: CPQSINFO-MIB The serial number of the physical system unit. The string will be empty if the system does not report the serial number function.

item.name: Overall system health status
item.description: MIB: CPQSINFO-MIB The overall condition. This object represents the overall status of the server information represented by this MIB.

discovery_rule.name: Array Controller Cache Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Array controllers: CPQIDA-MIB::cpqDaAccelTable

item_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller battery status
item_prototype.description:
MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Cache Module Board Backup Power Status. This monitors the status of each backup power source on the board. The backup power source can only recharge when the system has power applied. The type of backup power source used is indicated by cpqDaAccelBackupPowerSource. The following values are valid: Other (1) Indicates that the instrument agent does not recognize backup power status. You may need to update your software.
Ok (2) The backup power source is fully charged.
Recharging (3) The array controller has one or more cache module backup power sources that are recharging. Cache module operations such as Battery/Flash Backed Write Cache, Expansion, Extension and Migration are temporarily suspended until the backup power source is fully charged. Cache module operations will automatically resume when charging is complete.
Failed (4) The battery pack is below the sufficient voltage level and has not recharged in 36 hours. Your Cache Module board needs to be serviced.
Degraded (5) The battery is still operating, however, one of the batteries in the pack has failed to recharge properly. Your Cache Module board should be serviced as soon as possible.
NotPresent (6) A backup power source is not present on the cache module board. Some controllers do not have backup power sources.
Capacitor Failed (7) The flash backed cache module capacitor is below the sufficient voltage level and has not recharged in 10 minutes. Your Cache Module board needs to be serviced.

item_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Cache Module/Operations Status. This describes the status of the cache module and/or cache operations. Note that for some controller models, a cache module board that physically attaches to the controller or chipset may not be an available option.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:"failed"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:"capacitorFailed"},eq)}=1

discovery_rule.name: Physical Disk Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of physical drive entries CPQIDA-MIB::cpqDaPhyDrvTable.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk media type
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Drive Array Physical Drive Media Type.The following values are defined: other(1) The instrument agent is unable to determine the physical drive’s media type. rotatingPlatters(2) The physical drive media is composed of rotating platters. solidState(3) The physical drive media is composed of solid state electronics.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk model name
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Model.This is a text description of the physical drive. The text that appears depends upon who manufactured the drive and the drive type. If a drive fails, note the model to identify the type of drive necessary for replacement. If a model number is not present, you may not have properly initialized the drive array to which the physical drive is attached for monitoring.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Serial Number. This is the serial number assigned to the physical drive. This value is based upon the serial number as returned by the SCSI inquiry command but may have been modified due to space limitations. This can be used for identification purposes.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk size
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Size in MB. This is the size of the physical drive in megabytes. This value is calculated using the value 1,048,576 (2^20) as a megabyte. Drive manufacturers sometimes use the number 1,000,000 as a megabyte when giving drive capacities so this value may differ from the advertised size of a drive. This field is only applicable for controllers which support SCSI drives, and therefore is not supported by the IDA or IDA-2 controllers. The field will contain 0xFFFFFFFF if the drive capacity cannot be calculated or if the controller does not support SCSI drives.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk S.M.A.R.T. status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive S.M.A.R.T Status.The following values are defined: other(1) The agent is unable to determine if the status of S.M.A.R.T predictive failure monitoring for this drive. ok(2) Indicates the drive is functioning properly. replaceDrive(3) Indicates that the drive has a S.M.A.R.T predictive failure error and should be replaced.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Status. This shows the status of the physical drive. The following values are valid for the physical drive status: other (1) Indicates that the instrument agent does not recognize the drive. You may need to upgrade your instrument agent and/or driver software. ok (2) Indicates the drive is functioning properly. failed (3) Indicates that the drive is no longer operating and should be replaced. predictiveFailure(4) Indicates that the drive has a predictive failure error and should be replaced.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cpqDaPhyDrvSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1 and {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cpqDaPhyDrvSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Disk serial number has changed. Ack to close

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk failed
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check physical disk for warnings or errors

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check physical disk for warnings or errors

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.physicaldisk.smart_status[cpqDaPhyDrvSmartStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_SMART_FAIL_STATUS:"replaceDrive"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.physicaldisk.smart_status[cpqDaPhyDrvSmartStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_SMART_FAIL_STATUS:"replaceDriveSSDWearOut"},eq)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk S.M.A.R.T. failed
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Disk probably requires replacement.

item.name: Failover status
item.description: The failover status ID on the system. unknown - the failover status of the device is unknown. offline - the device is offline. forcedOffline - the device is forced offline. standby - the device is standby. active - the device is active.

item.name: Sync status
item.description: The sync status ID on the system. unknown - the device is disconnected from the device group syncing - the device is joining the device group or has requested changes from device group or inconsistent with the group. needManualSync - changes have been made on the device not syncd to the device group. inSync - the device is consistent with the device group. syncFailed - the device is inconsistent with the device group, requires user intervention. syncDisconnected - the device is not connected to any peers. standalone - the device is in a standalone configuration. awaitingInitialSync - the device is waiting for initial sync. incompatibleVersion - the device's version is incompatible with rest of the devices in the device group. partialSync - some but not all devices successfully received the last sync.

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor doing nothing for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor waiting for external I/O to complete for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor servicing hardware interrupts for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor running niced processes for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor servicing soft interrupts for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU steel time
item.description: The average time 'stolen' from the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor servicing system calls for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: CPU average usage ratio
item.description: This is average usage ratio of CPU for the system in the last one minute. It is calculated by (sum of deltas for user, niced, system)/(sum of deltas of user, niced, system, idle, irq, softirq, and iowait), where each delta is the difference for each stat over the last 1-minute interval.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: The average time spent by the specified processor in user context for the system in the last five seconds.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: The total host memory in bytes. This is for a single host system. For multiple host system, please refer sysMultiHost table.

item.name: Used memory
item.description: The host memory in bytes currently in use. This is for a single host system. For multiple host system, please refer sysMultiHost table.

item.name: Product name (marketing)
item.description: The system name used by marketing

item.name: Product build
item.description: The product build number.

item.name: Product edition
item.description: The product edition.

item.name: Product name
item.description: The product name.

item.name: Product version
item.description: The product version.

item.name: Server connections (SSL)
item.description: The current number of concurrent connections with established SSL sessions being maintained by the filter.

item.name: Server SSL connections per second (compat)
item.description: The total number of concurrent compat connections with established SSL sessions being maintained by the filter.

item.name: Server SSL connections per second (native)
item.description: The total number of concurrent native connections with established SSL sessions being maintained by the filter.

item.name: Client Bytes In
item.description: The number of bytes received by the system from client-side.

item.name: Client Bytes Out
item.description: The number of bytes sent to client-side from the system.

item.name: Client connections
item.description: The current connections from client-side to the system.

item.name: Client Packets In
item.description: The average number of packets received by the system from client-side in the last five seconds.

item.name: Client Packets Out
item.description: The number of packets sent to client-side from the system.

item.name: Client connects per second
item.description: The total connections from client-side to the system.

item.name: HTTP Requests per second
item.description: The total number of HTTP requests to the system.

item.name: Total memory (TMM)
item.description: The total memory available in bytes for TMM (Traffic Management Module).

item.name: Used memory (TMM)
item.description: The memory in use in bytes for TMM (Traffic Management Module).

item.name: Server Bytes In
item.description: The number of bytes received by the system from server-side.

item.name: Server Bytes Out
item.description: The number of bytes sent to server-side from the system.

item.name: Server connections
item.description: The current connections from server-side to the system.

item.name: Server connects per second
item.description: The total connections from server-side to the system.

item.name: Host name
item.description: The host name of the system on the network.

item.name: Uptime
item.description: The system up time in 1/100 seconds since boot.

item.name: Client accepts per second
item.description: The number of connections accepted.

item.name: SNMP trap for F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB notifications
item.description: A private enterprise MIB for F5 Networks Top-level infrastructure of the F5 enterprise MIB tree.

discovery_rule.name: Node stats discovery
discovery_rule.description: node name.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} current sessions
item_prototype.description: The number of current sessions going through the specified node address.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} incoming bytes
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes received by the specified node address from server-side.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} outgoing bytes
item_prototype.description: The number of bytes sent to server-side from the specified node address.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} current server connections
item_prototype.description: The current connections from server-side to the specified node address.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} incoming packets
item_prototype.description: The number of packets received by the specified node address from server-side.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} outgoing packets
item_prototype.description: The number of packets sent to server-side from the specified node address.

discovery_rule.name: Node status discovery
discovery_rule.description: node name.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} available
item_prototype.description: The availability of the specified node address indicated in color. none - error. green - available in some capacity. yellow - not currently available. red - not available. blue - availability is unknown. gray - unlicensed.

item_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} state
item_prototype.description: The activity status of the specified node address, as specified by the user.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmNodeAddrStatusEnabledState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=1 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmNodeAddrStatusAvailState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>1 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmNodeAddrStatusAvailState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>4
trigger_prototype.name: Node {#SNMPVALUE} is not available in some capacity: {ITEM.VALUE2}

discovery_rule.name: Pool status discovery
discovery_rule.description: The name of a pool.

item_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} available
Pool {#SNMPVALUE} enabled
item_prototype.description: The activity status of the specified pool, as specified by the user.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmPoolStatusEnabledState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=1 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmPoolStatusAvailState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>1 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmPoolStatusAvailState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>4
trigger_prototype.name: Pool {#SNMPVALUE} is not available in some capacity: {ITEM.VALUE2}

discovery_rule.name: Virtual server stats discovery
discovery_rule.description: virtual server name.

item_prototype.name: Virtual server {#SNMPVALUE} current client connections
item_prototype.description: The current connections from client-side to the specified VS name

discovery_rule.name: Virtual server status discovery
discovery_rule.description: The name of a virtual server.

item_prototype.name: Virtual server {#SNMPVALUE} availability
Virtual server {#SNMPVALUE} enabled
item_prototype.description: The activity status of the specified virtual server, as specified by the user.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmVsStatusEnabledState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=1 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmVsStatusAvailState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>1 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:ltmVsStatusAvailState[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<>4
trigger_prototype.name: Virtual server {#SNMPVALUE} is not available in some capacity: {ITEM.VALUE2}

discovery_rule.name: Chassis fan discovery
discovery_rule.description: The index of a chassis fan on the system. It identifies a particular chassis fan.

item_prototype.name: Chassis fan {#SNMPVALUE} speed
item_prototype.description: The actual speed of the indexed chassis fan on the system. This is only supported for the platform where the actual fan speed data is available. '0' means fan speed is unavailable while the associated chassis status is good.

item_prototype.name: Chassis fan {#SNMPVALUE} status
item_prototype.description: The status of the indexed chassis fan on the system. This is only supported for the platform where the sensor data is available.

trigger_prototype.name: Chassis fan {#SNMPVALUE} is in bad state
Chassis fan {#SNMPVALUE} is not present

discovery_rule.name: Power supply discovery
discovery_rule.description: The index of a power supply on the system.

item_prototype.name: Power supply {#SNMPVALUE} status
item_prototype.description: The status of the indexed power supply on the system. This is only supported for the platform where the sensor data is available.

trigger_prototype.name: Power supply {#SNMPVALUE} is in bad state
Power supply {#SNMPVALUE} is not present

discovery_rule.name: Chassis temperature discovery
discovery_rule.description: The index of a chassis temperature sensor on the system. It identifies a particular chassis temperature sensor, fan, etc.

item_prototype.name: Chassis sensor {#SNMPVALUE} temperature
item_prototype.description: The chassis temperature (in Celsius) of the indexed sensor on the system. This is only supported for the platform where the sensor data is available.

trigger_prototype.name: Chassis temperature ({ITEM.LASTVALUE}) of sensor {#SNMPVALUE} exceeds threshold of {$TEMP_HIGH} °C
Chassis temperature ({ITEM.LASTVALUE}) of sensor {#SNMPVALUE} exceeds threshold of {$TEMP_WARN} °C

trigger.expression: {Template OS AIX:vfs.file.cksum[/etc/passwd].diff(0)}>0
trigger.name: /etc/passwd has been changed on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template OS Linux:vfs.file.cksum[/etc/passwd].diff(0)}>0
trigger.name: /etc/passwd has been changed on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipBladeOffline)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A blade has failed - offline

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipBladeNoPower)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A blade lost power
trigger.description: The blade may be pulled out

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceConfigSettingChanged)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A configuration has been changed on a device

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipLogAlert)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: Action must be taken immediately for the system to work properly

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmDcAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A data center is becoming available in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmDcNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A data center is becoming unavailable in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmDcDisabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A data center is disabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmDcEnabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A data center is enabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceConfigSync)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device's configuration is out of sync with its peer

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emCertificateExpiration)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device certificate will expire soon

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceActiveMode)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device changed from non-ACTIVE to ACTIVE state

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceForcedOfflineMode)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device changed from non-FORCED OFFLINE to FORCED OFFLINE state

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceOfflineMode)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device changed from non-OFFLINE to OFFLINE state

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceStandbyMode)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device changed from non-STANDBY to STANDBY state

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceClockSkew)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A device clock is out of sync with EM

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDiskUsage)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A disk partition is exceeding configured usage limits

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipDosAttackStart)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A DOS attack start was detected

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipDosAttackStop)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A DOS attack stop was detected

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmBoxNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A gtm machine (which equates to an iquery connect to a gtm machine) has gone DOWN

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmBoxAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A gtm machine (which equates to an iquery connect to a gtm machine) has gone UP

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipFeatureOnline)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A high availability feature is now responding

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipFeatureFailed)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A high availability feature triggered action failed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emHotfixInstallComplete)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A hotfix has been installed on a managed device

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emHotfixInstallFailed)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A hotfix installation has failed

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmLinkAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A link is becoming available in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmLinkNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A link is becoming unavailable in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmLinkDisabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A link is disabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmLinkEnabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A link is enabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmAppAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An application is becoming available in global management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmAppNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An application is becoming unavailable in global management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmAppObjAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An application object is becoming available in global management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmAppObjNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An application object is becoming unavailable in global management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipExternalLinkChange)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An external interface link status changes
trigger.description: For a fixed port, this is an occurrence when network cables are connected or removed, and the network is reconfigured; for a pluggable port (such as a SFP or XFP port), this happens when the pluggable unit is plugged in or unplugged, or when a cable is connected or removed from a plugged port. The possible values are UP, DOWN, or UNPOPULATED.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipNetLinkDown)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An internal interface link is down
trigger.description: This is for L1 and L2. These are internal links within the box connecting the CPU and Switch subsystems, which should never lose link. If they do, it indicates a serious problem.

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceImpaired)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An managed device is impaired

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},emDeviceUnreachable)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: An managed device is unreachable

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipNodeRate)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A node has exceeded the allowed rate

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipNodeDown)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A node is detected DOWN

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipNodeUp)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A node is detected UP

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipAomCpuTempTooHigh)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: AOM reports the air temperature near the host CPU too high

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmPoolAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A pool is becoming available in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmPoolNotAvail)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A pool is becoming unavailable in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmPoolDisabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A pool is disabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipGtmPoolEnabled)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
trigger.name: A pool is enabled in global traffic management module

trigger.expression: {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].count({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC},bigipMemberRate)}<>0 and {Template SNMP f5 BIG-IP ADC:snmptrap[F5-BIGIP-COMMON-MIB].nodata({$TRIGGER_TIMEOUT_ADC})}=0
